meta.title: Complete Artificial Intelligence Masterclass - Foundations to AGI Research
meta.description: The most comprehensive 12-month Artificial Intelligence program covering classical AI, modern AI, intelligent systems, robotics, cognitive computing, multi-agent systems, AI ethics, and cutting-edge research. From search algorithms to artificial general intelligence concepts.
meta.level: Complete Beginner to AI Research Scientist
meta.certification: Advanced Artificial Intelligence Certification upon completion

program_overview.title: Complete Artificial Intelligence Masterclass
program_overview.tagline: From Classical AI to Artificial General Intelligence Research
program_overview.description:
This is not just an AI course—it's a complete journey through the entire landscape of Artificial Intelligence. Whether you're a complete beginner, computer science student, researcher, or professional wanting deep AI expertise, this 12-month masterclass will transform you into an AI expert with comprehensive knowledge spanning from classical symbolic AI to modern neural approaches, from theoretical foundations to practical intelligent systems.

You'll master AI from philosophical foundations to cutting-edge research: from search algorithms to knowledge representation, from expert systems to autonomous agents, from logic and reasoning to probabilistic AI, from planning to learning, from single agents to multi-agent systems, from narrow AI to AGI concepts. By the end, you'll have built 50+ intelligent systems, understood AI at the deepest level, published research, and be prepared for AI research scientist roles or PhD programs.
what_makes_this_different: Covers all AI paradigms: symbolic, connectionist, hybrid
Preparation for AI research careers and PhD

learning_path.phase_1: Foundations (Months 1-3): AI History, Search, Logic, Knowledge Representation, Problem Solving
learning_path.phase_2: Reasoning & Learning (Months 4-6): Probabilistic AI, Planning, Reasoning Under Uncertainty, ML Integration
learning_path.phase_3: Intelligent Systems (Months 7-9): Expert Systems, Agents, Robotics, Vision, NLP, Multi-Agent Systems
learning_path.phase_4: Advanced AI (Months 10-12): Cognitive AI, AGI, Research, Ethics, Philosophy, Emerging Frontiers

career_outcomes: AI Research Scientist / PhD Ready (after 12 months)

phase_1_foundation.title: PHASE 1: Classical AI Foundations (Months 1-3, Weeks 1-13)
phase_1_foundation.description: Build deep understanding of AI foundations, search algorithms, logic, knowledge representation, and problem-solving.

week_1_2.title: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence
topics: What is Artificial Intelligence? Definitions and perspectives
History of AI: from Dartmouth Conference to present
Narrow AI, General AI (AGI), Super AI
Symbolic AI vs Connectionist AI vs Hybrid AI
PEAS framework: Performance, Environment, Actuators, Sensors
Agent types: simple reflex, model-based, goal-based, utility-based
Agent environments: fully observable, deterministic, episodic, static
AI vs ML vs DL: relationships and differences
State of AI: current capabilities and limitations
week_1_2.practice: Study 20 landmark AI papers from history

week_3_4.title: Search Algorithms - Part 1 (Uninformed Search)
topics: Problem formulation: initial state, actions, goal test, path cost
Search strategies evaluation: completeness, optimality, time, space
Real-world applications: route finding, puzzle solving
week_3_4.practice: Implement all uninformed search algorithms from scratch

week_5_6.title: Search Algorithms - Part 2 (Informed/Heuristic Search)
topics: Memory-bounded heuristic search: IDA*, RBFS, SMA*
Weighted A* and bounded suboptimal search
week_5_6.practice: Solve 30 search problems with optimal algorithms

week_7_8.title: Adversarial Search & Game Playing
projects: Game AI framework with multiple algorithms

week_9_10.title: Propositional Logic
topics: Logical connectives: AND, OR, NOT, IMPLIES, IFF
WalkSAT and local search for SAT

week_13.title: Constraint Satisfaction Problems
topics: Variable ordering heuristics: MRV, degree heuristic
Structure in CSP: tree-structured, nearly tree-structured
projects: PHASE 1 MINI CAPSTONE: Intelligent Planning System with CSP
week_13.assessment: Phase 1 Exam - Search, Logic, Knowledge Representation, CSP

phase_2_frontend_mastery.title: PHASE 2: Reasoning, Planning & Probabilistic AI (Months 4-6, Weeks 14-26)
phase_2_frontend_mastery.description: Master probabilistic reasoning, planning algorithms, decision theory, and uncertainty management in AI.

week_29_30.title: Bayesian Networks
projects: Decision support system with Bayes nets

week_31_32.title: Markov Models & Temporal Reasoning
topics: Viterbi algorithm for most likely sequence

week_33_34.title: Decision Theory & Utility
topics: MDP formulation: states, actions, transitions, rewards
Applications: robotics, game playing, resource allocation

week_42_43.title: Explanation & Interpretability in AI
week_42_43.practice: Add explanations to all AI systems built

week_44.title: Phase 2 Capstone Project
projects: PHASE 2 CAPSTONE: Intelligent Decision Support System
Requirements: Bayesian reasoning, planning, decision theory, learning, explanations
Option 1: Medical diagnosis and treatment planning system
Option 3: Smart home energy management system
Option 4: Financial portfolio advisor with uncertainty
week_44.assessment: Phase 2 Exam - Probabilistic AI, Planning, Decision Theory, Learning

phase_3_backend_engineering.title: PHASE 3: Intelligent Systems & Applications (Months 7-9, Weeks 27-39)
phase_3_backend_engineering.description: Master expert systems, intelligent agents, robotics, computer vision, NLP, and multi-agent systems.

week_53_54.title: Expert Systems Architecture
topics: Expert system architecture: knowledge base, inference engine, UI
Limitations and decline of expert systems

week_57_58.title: Robotics & Embodied AI
topics: Applications: autonomous vehicles, drones, industrial robots

week_59_60.title: Computer Vision for AI Systems
topics: Applications: surveillance, medical imaging, autonomous systems

week_61.title: Natural Language Understanding (AI Perspective)
week_61.practice: Build 10 NLU systems with AI techniques

week_62_63.title: Multi-Agent Systems Fundamentals
topics: Applications: smart grids, traffic systems, e-commerce

week_64_65.title: Game Theory for Multi-Agent AI
topics: Applications in AI: auctions, negotiations, resource allocation

week_70.title: Phase 3 Capstone Project
projects: Requirements: Multiple agents, coordination, learning, real-world application
Option 1: Smart city traffic management with agents
Option 4: Multi-agent trading and auction system
week_70.assessment: Phase 3 Exam - Agents, Robotics, Vision, NLP, Multi-Agent Systems

phase_4_advanced_production.title: PHASE 4: Advanced AI, AGI & Research (Months 10-12, Weeks 40-52)
phase_4_advanced_production.description: Master cognitive architectures, AGI concepts, AI philosophy, ethics, cutting-edge research, and career preparation.

week_79_80.title: Cognitive Architectures
topics: Applications: human performance modeling, training systems

week_83_84.title: AI Philosophy & Theory of Mind
topics: Philosophy of AI: can machines think?
Global Workspace Theory applied to AI
Rights and moral status of AI
projects: Ethical reasoning system for AI consciousness
week_83_84.practice: Write 5 philosophical position papers on AI

week_85_86.title: AI Safety & Alignment
topics: Alignment problem: aligning AI with human values
Verification and validation of AI systems
Oracle AI, Tool AI, Agent AI risks
AI safety organizations: MIRI, FHI, DeepMind Safety

week_87.title: AI Ethics & Societal Impact
topics: Ethics in AI development and deployment
Bias and fairness in AI systems
AI in criminal justice: risks and concerns
Ethical frameworks: utilitarianism, deontology, virtue ethics
Global and cultural perspectives on AI ethics
week_87.practice: Conduct ethics review of all previous projects

week_88_89.title: AI Research Methodology
topics: Paper structure: abstract, intro, methods, results, conclusion
Publishing venues: NeurIPS, ICML, AAAI, IJCAI
projects: Literature review on chosen AI topic
week_88_89.practice: Read 50 research papers, write 3 paper summaries

week_90_91.title: Cutting-Edge AI Research Areas
topics: AI for science: protein folding, material discovery
AI for creativity: music, art, design
projects: Research experiment in chosen cutting-edge area

week_92_93.title: AI in Industry & Applications
topics: AI in healthcare: diagnosis, drug discovery, personalized medicine
AI in finance: algorithmic trading, fraud detection, risk assessment
AI in education: adaptive learning, tutoring systems
AI in transportation: autonomous vehicles, traffic optimization
AI in manufacturing: predictive maintenance, quality control
AI in agriculture: precision farming, crop monitoring
AI in energy: smart grids, optimization
AI in entertainment: games, content generation
AI in e-commerce: recommendations, search, chatbots
AI in cybersecurity: threat detection, response
AI in law: contract analysis, case prediction
AI in scientific research: discovery, experimentation
week_92_93.practice: Design AI solutions for 10 different industries

week_94_95.title: Career Paths in AI Research
topics: PhD programs in AI: top universities
AI research labs: Google AI, DeepMind, OpenAI, FAIR, Microsoft Research

week_96.title: Future of AI
topics: Your role in shaping AI future
week_96.practice: Write position paper on future of AI

week_100.title: Final Defense & Career Launch
projects: FINAL CAPSTONE: Original AI Research Contribution
Requirements: Novel AI system, theoretical contribution, extensive evaluation, publication-ready
- Novel cognitive architecture for general reasoning
- Hybrid neuro-symbolic system for causal reasoning
- AI safety mechanism for value alignment
- Explainable AI system with human-like reasoning
- Continual learning architecture with knowledge retention
week_100.assessment: FINAL COMPREHENSIVE EXAM + THESIS DEFENSE - Complete AI mastery evaluation

projects_throughout_course: Phase 1: 30+ foundational AI projects - search, logic, CSP, games
Phase 2: 35+ probabilistic and planning projects - Bayes nets, MDPs, planning systems
Phase 3: 40+ intelligent systems - expert systems, agents, robotics, multi-agent
Phase 4: 25+ advanced projects - cognitive AI, AGI research, ethics, novel systems
Total: 130+ AI projects from classical to cutting-edge
additional_learning_resources.total_projects_built: 130+ intelligent systems across all AI paradigms
skills_mastered: Classical AI: Search algorithms, game playing, constraint satisfaction, logic, knowledge representation
Probabilistic AI: Bayesian networks, HMMs, Kalman filters, DBNs, probabilistic reasoning
Planning: STRIPS, Graphplan, HTN, temporal planning, planning under uncertainty
Decision Theory: MDPs, POMDPs, decision networks, utility theory, game theory
Learning: Decision trees, RL (Q-learning, TD), hybrid symbolic-neural systems
Expert Systems: Rule-based systems, forward/backward chaining, explanation generation
Agents: BDI architecture, reactive agents, multi-agent systems, agent communication
Robotics: SLAM, path planning, motion control, robot perception
Vision: Classical computer vision, object recognition, scene understanding
NLP: Parsing, semantic analysis, question answering, dialogue systems
Multi-Agent: Coordination, negotiation, auctions, swarm intelligence, game theory
Cognitive AI: Cognitive architectures (SOAR, ACT-R), memory systems, metacognition
AGI: Common sense reasoning, causal reasoning, transfer learning, general intelligence
Philosophy: Mind theory, consciousness, ethics, AI safety, alignment
Research: Paper reading, writing, experimentation, publication, innovation
Tools: Python (expert), Prolog, knowledge representation languages, simulation environments

support_provided.research_guidance: Help with research direction and paper writing
support_provided.lifetime_access: All materials, updates, and advanced modules

certification.specialization_tracks: Choose: Cognitive AI / Multi-Agent Systems / AGI Research / AI Safety
certification.industry_recognized: Recognized by top AI research labs
certification.phd_ready: Preparation equivalent to first year PhD coursework

prerequisites.education: Bachelor's degree in CS/Engineering/Math/Physics recommended (not required)
prerequisites.mathematics: Comfort with calculus, linear algebra, probability (will be taught/reviewed)
prerequisites.programming: Basic programming knowledge helpful (Python taught from scratch for AI)
prerequisites.logic: Basic logical thinking (formal logic taught in course)
prerequisites.commitment: Very high - this is research-level training
prerequisites.mindset: Intellectual curiosity, love of theory + practice, research orientation
prerequisites.equipment: High-performance computer recommended, cloud computing provided
prerequisites.reading: Comfort reading academic papers and textbooks

who_is_this_for.ai_professionals: Industry professionals wanting deep theoretical knowledge
who_is_this_for.career_switchers: STEM backgrounds transitioning to AI research
who_is_this_for.academics: Faculty wanting to add AI research to their portfolio
who_is_this_for.engineers: Want to move from applied ML to AI research
who_is_this_for.innovators: Want to develop novel AI systems and algorithms
who_is_this_for.philosophers: Interest in AI, mind, consciousness, ethics
who_is_this_for.visionaries: Want to contribute to AGI development
who_is_this_for.serious_learners: Committed to mastering AI at the deepest level

career_paths_after_completion: AI Research Scientist (Industry labs: Google AI, DeepMind, OpenAI, FAIR, etc.)
PhD Student (Top AI programs: Stanford, MIT, CMU, Berkeley, Oxford, etc.)

salary_expectations.research_labs: DeepMind, OpenAI pay $300k-$1M+ for top researchers
salary_expectations.note: AI research is among highest-paid technical fields globally

academic_outcomes.phd_admissions: Prepared for top 20 AI PhD programs worldwide
academic_outcomes.conference_presentations: Ready to present at AAAI, IJCAI, NeurIPS, ICML
academic_outcomes.gre_preparation: Advanced AI knowledge for GRE Subject Test
academic_outcomes.fellowships: Competitive for NSF, Hertz, NDSEG fellowships

course_guarantees.phd_application_support: Complete application support for top programs
course_guarantees.advanced_modules: Free access to all future advanced topics
course_guarantees.conference_guidance: Help with conference submissions and attendance
course_guarantees.excellence_guarantee: Master AI at the deepest theoretical and practical level
